snippet: Pope Benedict XVI on Thursday delivered a stern pre-Easter homily directed at reform-minded priests who seek the ordination of women and the abolition of priestly celibacy. His denunciation of "disobedience", principally aimed at clerical reformists...
abstract: Pope Benedict XVI on Thursday delivered a stern pre-Easter homily directed at reform-minded priests who seek the ordination of women and the abolition of priestly celibacy. His denunciation of "disobedience", principally aimed at clerical reformists in Austria and their supporters in Europe and the U.S., struck a tone that once earned the pontiff the moniker "God's Rottweiler."
